  • Constructor Details

    • ResourceCard

      public ResourceCard(int cardID, int numCorners, boolean isFront, CardType cardType, CornerLabel TLCorner, CornerLabel TRCorner, CornerLabel BRCorner, CornerLabel BLCorner, ResourceType mainResource, int victoryPoints, int numResources, List<ResourceType> resourceList, boolean hasSymbol, SymbolType symbol)
      Constructs a ResourceCard with the specified attributes.
      Parameters:
      cardID - the unique identifier for the card.
      numCorners - the number of corners on the card.
      isFront - the side of the card (true if front, false if back).
      cardType - the type of the card.
      TLCorner - the label for the top-left corner.
      TRCorner - the label for the top-right corner.
      BRCorner - the label for the bottom-right corner.
      BLCorner - the label for the bottom-left corner.
      mainResource - the main resource associated with the card.
      victoryPoints - the number of victory points the card provides.
      numResources - the total number of resources on the card.
      resourceList - the list of resources on the card.
      hasSymbol - indicates if the card has a symbol.
      symbol - the symbol type of the card, if any.

    • getCornerContent

      public List<String> getCornerContent()
      Retrieves the content of the initial corners of the card as a list of strings. Each string represents the content of a corner in the following order: top-left, top-right, bottom-right, bottom-left.
      Specified by:
      getCornerContent in class PlayableCard
      Returns:
      A list containing the corner content strings.

    • getCornerContentString

      public String getCornerContentString(CornerLabel cornerLabel, int i)
      Retrieves the string representation of the content of a corner.
      Parameters:
      cornerLabel - The label indicating the type of content in the corner.
      i - An index used to retrieve the actual resource in case of 'WithResource' label.
      Returns:
      The string representing the corner content.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If an invalid corner label is provided.
